Miscellaneous¶

This category includes a few helpful utilities, a list of all GSM specific exceptions, and other potentially useful routines.

Signals¶

Almost all GSM specific errors and exceptions are included here. Additionally, this contains the exceptions for the control flow during the game.

exception UnknownElementError(obj)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown when trying to jsonify/unjsonify and an unknown object is found A common solution for custom objects is to make them :ref gsm.util.Jsonable.

exception GameOver[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Flag to be raised anywhere in a GamePhase or GameObject to end a game.

exception PhaseComplete(transfer=False)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Flag to be raised anywhere in a GamePhase or GameObject to end phase and move on to the next one in the GameStack.

transfer_action()[source]¶

Says whether the action should be transferred :return: bool whether or not the action should be sent to the next phase

exception SwitchPhase(phase, stack=True, send_action=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Flag to be raised anywhere in a GamePhase or GameObject to switch the current phase

transfer_action()[source]¶
Returns

flag whether the action should be copied to the new phase

Return type

bool

stacks()[source]¶
Returns

flag whether the current phase should be added back to the stack before beingging the new phase

Return type

bool

get_phase()[source]¶
Returns

new phase to switch to

get_phase_kwargs()[source]¶
Returns

keyword arguments for new phase (only used if it must be created)

exception InvalidKeyError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error if a key is not found in a dict like object

exception InvalidPlayerError(player)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error if an unregistered player is referenced

exception ClosedRegistryError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

The registries close after the game begins, so no new players, phases types, game object types, or config files can be registered.

exception RegistryCollisionError(key)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

When registering a new key (in any registry), this error is thrown if such a key is already in the register.

exception MissingTypeError(obj, *typs)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

When using an object, if the object is not registered but should be, this error is thrown.

exception MissingObjectError(name)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

When creating a GameObject this error is thrown if the obj_type of the GameObject has not been registered.

exception NoActiveGameError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown when GameController.step() is called before calling GameController.reset() (to start a game)

exception InvalidValueError(name)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Unknown value given to the host

exception UnknownUserError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Users must be registered before they call host methods

exception UnknownPlayerError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Players must be registered in the host.

exception UnknownGameError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown if a game is selected that has not been registered to the host.

exception UnknownInterfaceError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown if an unknown interface is used in the GameHost

exception WrappedException(etype, emsg, where=None)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Exception wrapper used for passing exceptions thrown in a parallel process to be thrown in the main process.

class ExceptionWrapper(interface=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Wraps an exception plus traceback to communicate across threads

reraise()[source]¶

Reraises the wrapped exception in the current thread

exception InvalidActionError(action)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown if the action is not recognized

exception ActionMismatch[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Flag thrown by an ActionTuple if any element doesn’t match (used while trying to match the received action to the possible ones).

exception UnknownActionElement(obj)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown if no possible action recognizes a certain element

exception InvalidInitializationError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

GameObjects and phases should be created through the GameController using GameController.create_obj and GameController.create_phase.

exception MissingValueError(typ, missing, *reqs)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

This error is thrown when a GameObject or GamePlayer is created without a required property (required properties are specified when registering)

exception ObjectIDCollisionError(ID)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Error thrown when specifying a GameObject’s ID when creating it, and the ID already exists

exception FormatException[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Unknown formatting information

Mixins¶

Contains several commonly used mixins to add common specific features to classes.

class Named(name, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Creates a name that must be provided in __init__

class Typed(obj_type, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

This specifies a type (in the form of a string) saved to “obj_type”, which must be passed in to __init__

get_type()[source]¶

Queries the obj_type (not related to type(self)) :return: obj_type

class Jsonable[source]¶

Bases: object

Object whose data can be formatted as a json object

jsonify()[source]¶

Get data from this object in the form of a json object. :return: A json object (only containing dict, list, and primitives)

class Pullable[source]¶

Bases: object

Can provide player specific information in the form of the standard GSM interface (eg. game objects visible to a certain player).

pull(player=None)[source]¶

Get player specific information using GSM interface. :param player: Optional to filter out information only visible to this player, otherwise returns only information visible to all players. :type player: gsm.core.GamePlayer :return: Must return a json object (only dict, list, and primitives)

class Writable[source]¶

Bases: object

Can reformat object data to be written to a log. To be writable this object must provide a “text value” which is a string of data that can be directly printed, a “text type” which should be a string meant to specify certain formatting, and “text info” which is a dict (string -> primitive) of any information.

get_text_val()[source]¶

The “text value” is the string of data that should be directly printable

Returns

text that can be displayed without formatting

Return type

str

get_text_type()[source]¶

The “text type” is a string which should specify a specific kind of formatting for this type of object. :return: type of object that is written :rtype: str

get_text_info()[source]¶

Optionally, additional formatting instructions can be provided in the form of a dict here. Note that: all keys must be strings and all values must be primitives. :return: A dict of additional and optional formatting instructions of the text :rtype: dict(str -> {str, int, float, bool})

Writing¶

Contains various utilities for writing objects to the log.

Utilities¶

General utilties.

jsonify(obj, tfm=None)[source]¶

Convert from a nested python data structure (containing dict, set, list, tuples, humpack objects etc.) to a json conpatible object (only dicts, lists, and primitives).

Parameters

  • obj – Input data structure to be jsonified

  • tfm – Custom transform function to jsonify special data structures (use with caution)

Returns

obj that can be transformed to json string using json.dump

unjsonify(obj, tfm=None)[source]¶

Convert from a json readable python data structure (containing dict, list, tuples, humpack objects etc.) to a json conpatible object (only dicts, lists, and primitives).

Parameters

  • obj – Input data structure to be unjsonified

  • tfm – Custom transform function to unjsonify certain data structures (use with caution)

obj_unjsonify(obj, table=None)[source]¶
Parameters

  • obj – data to be

  • table –

Returns

obj_cross_ref(obj, tables)[source]¶
